init.title: Get started with your Ledger device

initializedDevice.title: Use a device that's already initialized

noDevice.title: Do not have a Ledger device yet?

disclaimer.note1: Choose your own PIN code, this code will unlock your device.
disclaimer.note2: An 8-digit PIN code offers an optimum level of security.
disclaimer.note3: Never use a device supplied with a PIN code or a 24-word recovery phrase.

nano.step1: Connect the Ledger Nano S to your computer.
nano.step2: Press both buttons simultaneously as instructed on the screen.
nano.step3: Press the right button to select <1><0>Configure as new device?</0></1>
nano.step4: Choose a PIN code between 4 and 8 digits long, followed by the checkmark (✓).

blue.step1: Connect the Ledger Blue to your computer.
blue.step3: Choose a PIN code between 4 and 8 digits long.

nano.step1: Connect the Ledger Nano S to your computer.
nano.step2: Press both buttons simultaneously as instructed on the screen.
nano.step3: Press the left button to cancel <1><0>Initialize as new device?</0></1>. Then press the right button to select <3><0>Restore configuration?</0></3>
nano.step4: Choose a PIN code between 4 and 8 digits long, followed by the checkmark (✓).

blue.step1: Connect the Ledger Blue to your computer.
blue.step3: Choose a PIN code between 4 and 8 digits long.

initialize.title: Save your recovery phrase
initialize.desc: Your device will generate a 24-word recovery phrase to back up your private keys

nano.step1: Copy the word displayed below <1><0>Word #1</0></1> in position 1 on a blank Recovery sheet.
nano.step2: Press the right button to display <1><0>Word #2</0></1> and repeat the process until all 24 words are copied on the Recovery sheet.
nano.step3: Confirm your recovery phrase: select each requested word and press both buttons to validate it.

blue.step1: Copy each word of the recovery phrase on a blank Recovery sheet. Copy the words in the same order.
blue.step2: Tap <1><0>Next</0></1> to move to the next words. Repeat the process until the <3><0>Confirmation</0></3> screen appears.
blue.step3: Type each requested word to confirm your recovery phrase.

restore.title: Enter your recovery phrase
restore.desc: Copy the 24-word recovery phrase from your Recovery sheet on your device.

nano.step1: Select the length of your recovery phrase. Press both buttons to continue.
nano.step2: Select the first letters of <1><0>Word #1</0></1> by pressing the right or left button. Press both buttons to confirm each letter.
nano.step3: Select <1><0>Word #1</0></1> from the suggested words. Press both buttons to continue.
nano.step4: Repeat the process until the last word.

blue.step1: Select the length of your recovery phrase.
blue.step2: Type the first word of your recovery phrase. Select the word when it appears.
blue.step3: Repeat the process until the last word.

disclaimer.note1: Carefully secure your 24-word recovery phrase out of sight.
disclaimer.note2: Make sure you are the sole holder of your recovery phrase.
disclaimer.note3: Ledger does not keep any backup of your recovery phrase.
disclaimer.note4: Never use a device supplied with a recovery phrase or a PIN code.

genuineCheck.title: Security checklist
genuineCheck.descGeneric: Before continuing, please complete the security checklist

step1.title: Did you choose your PIN code by yourself?

step2.title: Did you save your recovery phrase by yourself?

title.pinFailed: Didn't choose your own PIN code?
title.recoveryPhraseFailed: Didn't save your own recovery phrase?
title.isGenuineFail: Oops, your device does not seem genuine...

desc.pinFailed: Never use a device supplied with a PIN code. If your device was provided with a PIN code, please contact us.
desc.recoveryPhraseFailed: Only save a recovery phrase that is displayed on your device. Please contact us in case of doubt. Otherwise, go back to the security checklist.
desc.isGenuineFail: Your device did not pass the authenticity test required to connect to Ledger’s secure server. Please contact Ledger Support to get assistance.

setPassword.title: Password lock (optional)
setPassword.desc: Set a password to prevent unauthorized access to Ledger Live data stored on your computer, including account names, balances, transactions and public addresses.

disclaimer.note1: Make sure to remember your password. Do not share it.
disclaimer.note2: Losing your password requires resetting Ledger Live and re-adding accounts.
disclaimer.note3: Resetting Ledger Live does not affect your crypto assets.

analytics.title: Analytics and bug reports
analytics.desc: Share anonymous usage and diagnostics data to help improve Ledger products, services and security features.

shareAnalytics.title: Share analytics
shareAnalytics.desc: Enable analytics to help Ledger understand how to improve the user experience.

mandatoryContextual.item7: Number of accounts, currencies and operations
mandatoryContextual.item10: Device firmware and app version numbers

sentryLogs.title: Report bugs
sentryLogs.desc: Automatically send reports to help Ledger fix bugs.

technicalData.title: Technical data *
technicalData.desc: Ledger will automatically collect technical information to get basic feedback on usage. This information is anonymous and does not contain personal data.

finish.title: Your device is ready!
finish.desc: Proceed to your portfolio and start adding your accounts...
